data.title: Fastest Train Route
data.statement: Find the shortest travel time between two train stations using direct train connections.
data.constraints:
The train network is directed (one-way connections).
No duplicate connections exist between the same stations.
1 ≤ [[N]] ≤ 10
1 ≤ [[M]] ≤ 100
0 ≤ [[A]], [[B]] < [[N]]
1 ≤ [[T]] ≤ 100
0 ≤ [[origin]], [[destination]] < [[N]]
data.stubGenerator:
read n:int m:int
loop m read a:int b:int t:int
read origin:int destination:int
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> 2 integers [[N]]  [[M]] seperated by spaces, representing the number of stations and the number of train connections.

<<[[M]] next lines :>> 3 integers [[A]] [[B]] [[T]] seperated by spaces, meaning a train travels from station [[A]] to station [[B]] in [[T]] minutes.

<<Last line :>> 2 integers [[origin]]  [[destination]] seperated by spaces, the start station and the destination station.
data.outputDescription: A single integer representing the minimum travel time from [[origin]] to [[destination]].

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Find the shortest travel time between two train stations using direct train connections.
Input
Line 1: 2 integers N M seperated by spaces, representing the number of stations and the number of train connections.

M next lines : 3 integers A B T seperated by spaces, meaning a train travels from station A to station B in T minutes.

Last line : 2 integers origin destination seperated by spaces, the start station and the destination station.
Output
A single integer representing the minimum travel time from origin to destination.
Constraints
The train network is directed (one-way connections).
No duplicate connections exist between the same stations.
1 ≤ N ≤ 10
1 ≤ M ≤ 100
0 ≤ A, B < N
1 ≤ T ≤ 100
0 ≤ origin, destination < N
Example
Input
3 2
0 1 5
1 2 7
0 2
Output
12
